aws::graph::propositions: # Helicopter Emergency Landing Incident Details
The rotor rpm decreased again.
The pilot elected to land in the field.
The helicopter struck the ground with the tail low.
The tail-low ground strike resulted in damage to the tail rotor.
The tail-low ground strike resulted in damage to the tail boom.
The pilot held a commercial pilot certificate.
The pilot held a flight instructor certificate.
The pilot was 46 years old.
The pilot had no airplane ratings.
The pilot occupied the left seat.
The pilot had helicopter aircraft ratings.
The pilot used lap-only restraint.
The pilot had helicopter instrument ratings.
No second pilot was present.
The pilot had helicopter instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held Class 2 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on December 24, 2012.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on April 16, 2013.
The pilot had 1347 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 210 total flight hours in this make and model of helicopter.
The pilot had 548 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 41 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 41 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 1 flight hour in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had accumulated 1,352 total flight hours.
The pilot had accumulated 1,315 flight hours in helicopters.
The pilot had accumulated 210 flight hours in the make and model of the accident helicopter.
The pilot had accumulated 41 hours in the accident helicopter in the preceding 30 days.

text:
The rotor rpm decreased again so the pilot elected to land in the field. The helicopter struck the ground with the tail low, which resulted in damage to the tail rotor and tail boom.

## Pilot Information

Certificate | Commercial; Flight instructor
--- | ---
Age | 46
Airplane Rating(s) | None
Seat Occupied | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s) | Helicopter
Restraint Used | Lap only
Instrument Rating(s) | Helicopter
Second Pilot Present | No
Instructor Rating(s) | Helicopter
Toxicology Performed | No
Medical Certification | Class 2 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam | December 24, 2012
Occupational Pilot | Yes
Last Flight Review or Equivalent | April 16, 2013
Flight Time | 1347 hours (Total, all aircraft), 210 hours (Total, this make and model), 548 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 41 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 41 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 1 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

The pilot, age 46, held a commercial pilot certificate for a helicopter and an instrument helicopter rating. He also held a flight instructor certificate for helicopters. The pilot reported having accumulated 1,352 total flight hours, of which 1,315 hours were in a helicopter, and 210 hours were in the make and model of the accident helicopter. He had accumulated 41 hours in the accident helicopter in the preceding 30 days.

---
